title: The Library of the U.S.A.
abstract:
The Library of the U.S.A.—A Public Works Program
In 1935, FDR launched the Works Progress Administration, an employment relief program that 
changed the face of America, creating some of most enduring buildings, bridges, parks, and 
schools.  A small part of that national effort was the Federal Writers Project, which created 800 
books including the American Guide Series, called by many “the most comprehensive 
encyclopedia of Americana ever published.”  The Library of the U.S.A. is a series of
